title: Mozambique: Nyusi Reaffirms Openness to Foreign Investment
text:

The investors include the construction companies, Mota Engil, Soares da Costa and Teixeira Duarte. Also attending the dinner were the Visabeira Group, the Entreposto Group and the Joao Ferreira dos Santos Group, which have wide ranging interests in agriculture, services and hotels. 
The dinner was offered by the Portuguese ambassador, Jose Duarte, and took place less than a week before a state visit to Portugal by Nyusi, scheduled for 15-18 July. 
“You are the champions of promoting investment in Mozambique”, Nyusi told the businessmen. “We would like to reaffirm that we are open for investment, and we hope that your companies will continue to invest in our country”. 
“Your role has been very important in building our economy”, he added. “Your investment makes the Mozambican economy more robust, through job creation and establishing a good business environment”. 
Duarte declared that, as long as the doors of Mozambique remained open, this group of companies intends to continue investing in the country. 
“Many of them have been established in the Mozambican market for a long time”, said the ambassador. 
“We would like to assure the President that he can and should count on us to increase our investments”. 
Pedro Palinha, chairperson of the Entreposto Group, one of the major players in the Mozambican motor vehicle market, declared “we would like to approach the President whenever possible to understand the objectives of his governance, and how he regards investment”. 
Entreposto, he said, had already invested over 200 million euros in Mozambique “and we want to continue investing in the country”. Mozambique
